titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Albert E. Smith Papers LSC.2004
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Manuscripts Division staff; machine-readable finding aid created by Caroline Cubé and edited by Josh Fiala, November 2002.

p.date: Online finding aid last updated 2021 January 11.

address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-08-24 15:40:26 -0700.

did.unittitle: Albert E. Smith papers
did.abstract: Albert E. Smith (1875-1958) co-founded the Vitagraph Company of America as the Reader, Smith, and Blackton Combination in 1894. He invented the Vitagraph, one of the first successful motion picture projectors, in 1896. The collection consists of correspondence, scrapbooks, albums, photographs, auditor's reports, and trade agreements pertaining to the business of the Vitagraph Company of America, of which Smith was co-founder.
did.physloc: Stored off-site. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: CONTAINS AUDIOVISUAL MATERIALS: This collection contains processed audiovisual materials. All requests to access digital materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Property rights to the objects belong to UCLA Library Special Collections. All other rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Albert E. Smith papers (Collection 2004). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived user interest and research value, availability of staff and resources, and competing priorities. Library Special Collections provides a standard level of preservation and access for all collections and, when time and resources permit, conducts more intensive processing. These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards and best practices.

We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Potentially Offensive Description in Library Special Collections.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Smith was born in 1875 in Faversham, England; co-founded the Vitagraph Company of America as the Reader, Smith, and Blackton Combination in 1894; Vitagraph producer, writer, and executive with actor and director J. Stuart Blackton until sale of the company to Warner Brothers in 1925; invented the Vitagraph, one of the first successful motion picture projectors, in 1896; had a wife, Lucile, and 6 children; died August 1, 1958 in Los Angeles.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Collection consists of correspondence, scrapbooks, albums, photographs, auditor's reports, and trade agreements pertaining to the business of the Vitagraph Company of America, of which Smith was co-founder. Runs of ephemeral publications, Vitagraph releases (1916-1920) and six bound volumes of the Vitagraph Bulletin (1906-1916) complete the Vitagraph documentation. There are 17 reels of audiotapes recorded by Smith on the subject of motion picture history, as well as a copy of his autobiography.

arrangement.head: Organization and Arrangement
arrangement.p:
Arranged in the following series:
Collection arranged chronologically.

controlaccess.subject: Motion picture industry -- History -- Archives.

did.unittitle: Early beginnings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Newspaper clippings, documents, early film catalogs (1901-1904), folder of notes for book and typescript manuscripts of history of Vitagraph Company by Albert E. Smith.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, ephemera and clippings, auditor's reports, stock certificates, agreements (bound volume) re ownership of Vitagraph Company and By-Laws of Smith-Blackton Company, 1916.

did.unittitle: Vitagraph Bulletins.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, contracts, auditor's statements. The Big Four Family, publication of Vitagraph, Lubin, Selig, Essanay, Incorporated. Bound (vol.1-4).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, legal documents; Vitagraph Releases. 1916-1917 (two bound volumes). Vitagraph family, vol.9-12. June 1917-June 1918 (bound).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, legal documents, auditor's reports. Vitagraph Releases. 1918, 1919 (two bound volumes). Shadowland, the magazine of magazines. (M.P. Publishing Company, New York). vol.1 no.1. September 1919.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, contracts and agreements, copies of legal briefs involving Vitagraph Company, auditor's reports. Typescript of Releases 1920 (bound) containing synopses and credits.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Legal documents, correspondence.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, publicity releases.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, ephemera, photographs, auditor's report 1917.Two reels and a crank. Autographed copy of book.

did.unittitle: Notebooks containing story ideas. Reports on individual theatres. Legal contracts.
Stills.
Scrapbook of clippings on the death of John Bunny.
Scrapbook of newspaper clippings.
Miscellaneous motion-picture publications.
History of Vitagraph Company.
Photograph album. Stills from Vitagraph productions of O'Henry stories.

Album of stills.
Scrapbook.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Newspaper clippings covering Vitagraph's break with Hays Office (MPPDA).
